subject: Politics
title: Platform Power
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Platform Power.

hook.text: Twitter banned a sitting US president. A tech company decided who could speak. That's unprecedented power.

buildup.text: Social media platforms decide what content stays and what gets removed. They're the new gatekeepers of speech.

discovery.text: Section 230 protects US platforms from liability for user content. It's the legal foundation of the internet economy.

twist.text: Platforms moderate inconsistently. They struggle to balance free speech, safety, and commercial interests.

climax.text: Governments worldwide want to regulate platforms. But too much regulation risks censorship; too little enables harm.

punchline.text: Platforms control speech more than governments. The rules aren't written yet.

quiz.question: What is Section 230?
options: A US law protecting platforms from liability for user-generated content
A regulation requiring platforms to verify all content
A tax on social media advertising revenue
